title.narrative: OUTPUT 2.2 QUALITY EDUCATION

description.narrative: Output 2.2. By 2025, girls and boys demonstrate increased learning achievement in literacy and numeracy through increased access to inclusive, equitable and relevant quality education, which contributes to Access To Quality Learning Opportunities, Learning, Skills, Participation And Engagement. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Systems Strengthening And Institution Building, Systems Strengthening To Leave No One Behind. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: 2. By 2025, girls and boys aged 3-19 progressively achieve age-appropriate learning outcomes

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Output 2.2. By 2025, girls and boys demonstrate increased learning achievement in literacy and numeracy through increased access toinclusive, equitable and relevant quality education

description.narrative: The phased return of different classes to education institutions enabled candidates to sit for their final examinations in March 2021. Continuity of learning was supported through provision of home learning materials, broadcasted lessons and Assistive Digital Technology equipment for children with disabilities. Capacity was built on Digital School Management and Financial Records, the Education Management Information System and education systems strengthening.; However, the COVID-19 second wave prolonged school closure and resulted in an increased learning loss. In response, a resurgence COVID -19 response plan for schools was developed, with advocacy for safe school reopening and teacher vaccination ongoing. | Status:Constrained | As-of Date:08/01/2022
